captions.text:
You can have her. l go away.
l'm gonna disappear.

You'll never see me again.
Please, Tony, l don't want to die.
l never did nothing to nobody.

No, no, you never did
nothing to nobody.

You had somebody else do it foryou.
Tony, l am begging you--

Get up! Get up now!
Jesus! No! God! [ Sobbing ]
[ Sobbing Continues ]

Look. Tony, no,
don't kill me, please.

[ frank Moans ]
l won't kill you.

Oh, Christ, thankyou.
Get offmy foot.
Thankyou. Thankyou.
No! No! No!
Oh!
[ Sighs ]
Evey dog has his day, huh, Mel?
l told him...

it didn't make any sense, clipping you
when we had you working for us.
He wouldn't listen.

He got hot tonight,
about the broad, you know?
He fucked up.

You too, Mel.
You fucked up.
Don't go too far, Tony.

[ Sighs ]
l'm not, Mel. You are.
[ Groaning, Gasps ]

Fuck.
You can't shoot a cop!
Whoever says you was one?
Wait a minute!

You let me go.
l'll fix this up.
Sure, Mel.
Maybeyou can hand yourself...

one ofthem first-class tickets
to the Resurrection.

Fuckin' punk!
Son ofa bitch!

- So long, Mel. Have a good trip.
- Fuckyou!

Okay, come on.
What about Ernie?
You want ajob, Ernie?

- Sure, Tony.
- Okay, then you call me tomorrow.

Hey, man, you got ajob!
[ Chuckles ]
Hey, Tony! Thanks.
[ Chi Chi Chuckling ]

title: Scarface (4/8) Movie CLIP - Every Dog Has His Day (1983) HD

comments.author: Sam Angelo

comments.text:
You may not be aware just how lucky Ernie's been. As we all know, he 
managed to live another day AND stay employed after this. Not everyone 
realizes, however, that he made sure to disappear quickly after this 
incident, popping up on the opposite coast in Hollywood and working as a 
parking lot security guard, under a new name. Who would have guessed that 
one day, many years later, our friend here would be discovered by Jimmy 
Kimmel and welcomed onto his show as a recurring character.

Oh, Ernie, you've come a long way.﻿

comments.author: Brian Vaughn

comments.text:
I said it was underrated, and like I said don't always trust IMDb anyone 
can go in there and give reviews, I suggest rottentomatoes if you like pro 
critics (they also have user scores) or metacritic if you are looking for a 
good movie, but imdb is not the one to go. This movie WAS under appreciated 
when it was released but later on the movie grew on people and it 
eventually became cult classic..... That's my point. Sorry for going so 
long.
comments.author: Wiizardii

comments.text:
+Wiizardii

If it's seen as a classic, then why would you not agree that it's anything 
but underrated? Everyone knows of Scarface, and many would argue that the 
film is overrated. I don't see how anyone can call this film underrated, 
especially since it's the face of crime movies from the 1980s.

And as for IMDb, it has Scarface in their top 250 movies.

comments.author: PerfectMisconception

comments.text:
+TypicalJAFO thank you very much friend for your brilliant insight. i never 
thought of it that way. i always thought that mel was pretending to be a 
cop and he was just some sort of snitch just like the cunt who got tony set 
up with the colombians....
comments.author: PerfectMisconception

comments.text:
+PerfectMisconception I took it to mean that Mel was so dirty and corrupt, 
he really couldn't expect to be protected from Tony's revenge just because 
he was a cop.   He was breaking the laws he was supposed to uphold, and 
that made him fair game, in Tony's view.

To draw a parallel, in the days of Al Capone's Chicago, a newsman named 
Jake Lingle was murdered by some mobsters.  The public was outraged - 
killing a newsman was something you just didn't do.   As the story leaked 
out bit by bit, though, it turned out Lingle was killed not because he was 
reporting on mobster activity, but because he was deeply involved in the 
rackets themselves.  Among other things, he fed Capone info on police 
raids, he spied on Moran's gang on the northside, and he was a big-time 
gambler.  He was dirty, and at some point, made the wrong people mad and 
paid the price for being dirty, just like any other criminal.
comments.author: TypicalJAFO

word "Handl" which means to bargain or negotiate.  Frank Lopez was Jewish 
so Tony was probably exposed to the word.

"Scarface palm tree mural" and you should see some places selling them.
